JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Feodosiya .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings in ORG against the ORG - owned company GPE seeking compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage caused by allegedly unlawful electricity cuts and inaccurate calculation of her electricity charges .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant modified her claims on six occasions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged a counter - claim on behalf of GPE seeking recovery of electricity charges not paid by the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with the same court a defamation claim against GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court joined that claim to the original proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the applicant 's claims as unsubstantiated and allowed the counter - claim , ordering the applicant to pay CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that judgment and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE , the applicant requested the court to suspend the proceedings . On DATE the request was granted . The applicant denied that she had made such a request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings were resumed .

CARDINAL . By a procedural decision of DATE the court ordered the parties to check the payments already made for electricity and to inform the court accordingly . According to the ORG , the applicant failed to comply with that decision . The applicant denied that contention . On DATE the court reiterated its order and , by DATE , the parties had submitted the information concerning the payments .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's claims and ordered her to pay UAH CARDINAL in debts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's appeal was rejected for failure to comply with procedural requirements . The applicant disagreed and challenged the ruling of DATE on appeal . DATE and DATE her appeals were dealt with by the court of first instance and on appeal . Ultimately , the appeals were allowed and on DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE ORG examined the applicant 's complaint that the judge of the first - instance court dealing with her case had taken too long to examine her appeals . ORG allowed the applicant 's complaint and issued an official reprimand against the judge .
CARDINAL . Following reconsideration of the case , on DATE ORG found against the applicant and ordered her to pay ORG in debts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's appeal as lodged out of time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the ruling of DATE .

CARDINAL . Out of CARDINAL court hearings held in the course of the proceedings , CARDINAL was adjourned due to the applicant 's failure to appear , CARDINAL were adjourned due to the prosecutor 's failure to appear , CARDINAL were adjourned due to both parties ' failure to appear , CARDINAL were adjourned due to GPE 's representative 's failure to appear , and CARDINAL were adjourned due to the judge 's absence . According to the Government , the parties submitted CARDINAL procedural requests , asking the courts , in particular , to call witnesses and to secure evidence . Some of the requests were allowed , resulting in the postponement of the hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG seeking compensation for damage to her reputation allegedly caused by the latter .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court joined GPE as a respondent to the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a similar claim against GPE with the same court . This was joined to the proceedings concerning her initial claim for compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the applicant 's claims as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's appeal in cassation as unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the applicant lodged CARDINAL separate complaints with ORG against the judge dealing with her dispute with GPE , alleging inactivity on the part of the judge with regard to her appeal against ORG judgment of DATE .

The applicant 's complaints were rejected as falling outside the jurisdiction of the courts . In particular , NORP law granted judges and courts immunity from civil and administrative proceedings against them for actions and decisions taken in their official capacity .
